content: treasured toes simple ribbed sock a top down knitted sock pattern by christine long derks the treasuregoddess yarn 1 skein of treasured toes sock yarn 75% superwash merino wool 25% nylon 100 grams 423 meters / 463 yards and 50 yards of contrasting color for cuff edge and toes if desired or 400-450 yards of your favorite sock yarn colorways shown are pieces of eight silver gray and song of the sirens wine accent kits and sock yarn available at http //www treasuregoddess com needles/notions set of 4 double pointed needles size us 1 2 25 mm or size us 1 5 2 5 mm whichever size gives you gauge or long circular needle in size us 1 or us 1 5 if you use magic loop method darning needle to weave in ends one stitch marker if desired i usually just use the cast on tail to tell me where my round began gauge approximately 7-8 stitches/inch in stockinette stitch gauge is not too important for this project just know that if your gauge is significantly different you may need additional yarn this is a go-to pattern for socks that fit everyone finished size the 3x1 ribbing stretches so well it fits all widths of feet adult medium 8-9 circumference or adult large 9-9 5 circumference it also looks amazing in wild hand painted colorways the different colors of cuffs & toes are optional www treasuregoddess com you can knit the whole socks out of one skein abbreviations k = knit p = purl k2tog = knit 2 stitches together decreases 1 stitch ssk = slip slip knit slip 1 knitwise slip 1 knitwise knit those 2 stitches together through the back loops decreases 1 stitch make 1 = insert left needle from front to back into horizontal strand between stitches knit stitch through back loop increases 1 stitch rs = right side side facing out when worn ws = wrong side side of work facing towards foot/leg when worn treasured toes simple ribbed sock directions sizes will be written as med lg cuff using contrast color cast on 64 72 stitches loosely for size med lg join being careful not to twist stitches divide stitches evenly across 3 double pointed needles place stitch marker for beginning of round if used round 1 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end of round repeat round 1 for a total of 10 rounds cut yarn leave long enough tail to weave in ends when completed leg use main color yarn until toe section leave long enough tail to weave in ends when completed often i loosely tie the two ends contrast color and main color in a small bow to keep out of the way while knitting round 1 *k3 purl 1 repeat from * to end of round repeat round 1 until sock measures 6 inches from cast on edge or to
